candidates.content:
South Korea: President Yoon addresses nation before his arrest
The impeached president said he will comply with questioning to "prevent unsavoury bloodshed."
5 days agoAsia
BBC reports from between groups of protesters in Seoul
Large crowds of critics and supporters of impeached President Yoon gathered outside his residence before his arrest.
5 days agoAsia
Millions perform bathing ritual on day two of India's Mahakumbh Mela
The BBC's Samira Hussain describes what she saw at the world's largest religious gathering.
5 days agoAsia
Watch: Sea of humanity at world's largest religious gathering
The BBC is at the Mahakumbh Mela, the Hindu festival expected to draw 400 million visitors over six weeks.
6 days agoAsia
Race to find survivors after deadly Tibet earthquake
The 7.1 magnitude quake killed scores of people in the mountainous region, with many more injured.
7 Jan 2025Asia
S Korea president's supporters rally at his residence, invoking Trump
Backers of Yoon Suk Yeol waved signs reading "stop the steal", as police called off an attempted arrest.
3 Jan 2025Asia
Watch: Rocket blasts off for India's first space-docking mission
The rocket, which took off from a site north of Chennai, places two satellites in orbit.
30 Dec 2024Asia
Grief and anger from families at South Korea airport
The BBC's Jean Mackenzie speaks to bereaved relatives waiting to know more about the Jeju Air crash.
30 Dec 2024Asia
At the scene of the South Korea plane crash investigation
The BBC's Asia correspondent visited the scene, where investigators are sifting through the fuselage.
30 Dec 2024Asia
Video captures moments before South Korea plane crash
The Jeju Air flight landing at Muan Airport had 181 passengers on board when it crashed off the runway.
29 Dec 2024Asia
What just happened in South Korea?
Lawmakers vote to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo, two weeks after voting to impeach the president.
27 Dec 2024Asia
Former Indian PM Manmohan Singh: In his own words
The economist and political leader, who died this week, has made many memorable public speeches.
27 Dec 2024Asia
Watch: Former Indian PM Manmohan Singh's life and legacy
One of India's longest-serving leaders, Singh has died at the age of 92.
26 Dec 2024Asia
Watch: 90-year-old with Parkinson's enters weightlifting contest
The woman lifted 45kg with family cheering her on, at a contest organised for the elderly in Taipei.
23 Dec 2024Asia
Ros Atkins On... Four reasons why the relationship between the UK and China is strained
The BBC's Analysis Editor Ros Atkins looks at how relations between the UK and China became so strained.
20 Dec 2024Asia
Garage CCTV shows moment earthquake hits Vanuatu
Footage shows people running and items falling off shelves as the earthquake strikes.
17 Dec 2024Asia
Watch: Protesters jubilant as South Korea president impeached
Crowds gathered outside the National Assembly loudly cheered at the announcement.
14 Dec 2024Asia
Watch: Moment South Korean lawmakers vote to impeach President Yoon
MPs in Seoul voted 204 in favour and 85 against the motion.
14 Dec 2024Asia
South Korea has voted to impeach President Yoon - now what?
The BBC's Jean Mackenzie explains what happens next following the impeachment of Yoon Suk Yeol.

final_result.explanation: The internal check shows high confidence (10) in the caption's accuracy because the image clearly depicts a large waterspout that could be considered dangerous. However, the external check has low confidence (3) and finds no supporting evidence in the provided articles.  There's a significant discrepancy between the internal and external validation. The internal validation relies solely on visual interpretation of the image, while the external validation attempts to verify the existence of the event through news articles. The lack of external corroboration significantly lowers the overall confidence.  The absence of relevant information in the external sources does not disprove the existence of the waterspout, but it highlights the lack of evidence to support the claim of a "massive, dangerous waterspout" being "real." It is possible that this waterspout event was not widely reported or that the provided articles are not relevant sources for this specific event.  Considering the high confidence of the internal check based on the image alone and the low confidence of the external check due to lack of evidence, a conservative approach is taken to avoid overconfidence. The final assessment leans towards the external validation because the absence of corroborating evidence casts doubt on the caption's claim.
final_result.validation_summary: Internal validation strongly supports the caption based on image analysis, while external validation fails to find corroborating evidence. The discrepancy lowers overall confidence; the claim remains unverified.
